intro: Pistolochia lineariloba, commonly known as the slender leaf pistolpod, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually small and yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, while the linear, elongated pods contain the seeds. The species is notable for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
